intro: Blakwellia moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
